briefdescription.para: Aborts the resolution of the current time step.
Compute the value the Problem would like for the next time step.

detaileddescription.para: This value will not necessarily be used at the call of initTimeStep, but it is a hint. This method may use all the internal state of the Problem.

parameterdescription.para: Does the Problem want to stop ?

briefdescription.para: This method is used to find the names of input fields understood by the Problem.

simplesect.para: (vector<string>) list of names usable with getInputFieldTemplate and setInputField

briefdescription.para: This method is used to get a template of a field expected for the given name.

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::string &name, const double x, const double y, const double z, int compo=0)
memberdef.name: getOutputPointValues

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::string &name, const std::vector< double > &x, const std::vector< double > &y, const std::vector< double > &z, std::vector< double > &vals, int compo=0)
memberdef.name: getOutputPointValues

briefdescription.para: This method is called once at the beginning, before any other one of the interface Problem.
This method allocates and initializes the unknown and given fields for the future time step.

detaileddescription.para: The value of the interval is imposed through the parameter dt. In case of error, returns false.

parameterdescription.para: dt) the time interval to allocate

simplesect.para: (bool) true=OK, false=error, not able to tackle this dt

briefdescription.para: Tells if the Problem unknowns have changed during the last time step.
In the case solveTimeStep uses an iterative process, this method executes a single iteration.

detaileddescription.para: It is thus possible to modify the given fields between iterations. converged is set to true if the process has converged, ie if the unknown fields are solution to the problem on the next time step. Otherwise converged is set to false. The return value indicates if the convergence process behaves normally. If false, the ProblemTrio wishes to abort the time step resolution.

parameterdescription.para: converged) It is a return value : true if the process has converged, false otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: This value may change only at the call of validateTimeStep. A surcharger

briefdescription.para: As initialize doesn't have any arguments, they can be passed to the Problem at the time of instantiation.

detaileddescription.para: They can include data file name, MPI communicator,.. In this implementation (for use outside TRUST), only the name of an underlying Probleme_U needs to be provided.

briefdescription.para: Reset the current time of the Problem to a given value.

detaileddescription.para: New in version 2 of ICoCo. Particularly useful for the initialization of complex transients: the starting point of the transient of interest is computed first, the time is reset to 0, and then the actual transient of interest starts with proper initial conditions, and global time 0.
Can be called outside the TIME_STEP_DEFINED context (see Problem documentation).

parameterdescription.para: exception if called before initialize() or after terminate().
exception if called inside the TIME_STEP_DEFINED context (see Problem documentation)

briefdescription.para: This method is used to provide the Problem with an input field.
Calculates the unknown fields for the next time step.

simplesect.para: (bool) true=OK, false=unable to find the solution.

briefdescription.para: This method is called once at the end, after any other one.

detaileddescription.para: It frees the memory and saves anything that needs to be saved.

briefdescription.para: Validates the calculated unknown by moving the present time at the end of the time step.

detaileddescription.para: This method is allowed to free past values of the unknown and given fields.

para.verbatim: This class defines the API a problem has to implement in order to be coupled. For precise specifications and possible use of this API, See NT SSTH/LMDL_2006_001 Implements IterativeUnsteadyProblem and FieldIO
